definition: (once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
cheating neither old nor young (idiom); treating youngsters and old folk equally scrupulously/Our house offers sincere treatment to all and fair trade to old and young alike.
Geoffrey Chaucer (1343-1400), English poet, author of The Canterbury Tales 坎特伯雷故事集[Kan3 te4 bo2 lei2 Gu4 shi4 Ji2]
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
Geoffrey Chaucer (1343-1400), English poet, author of The Canterbury Tales 坎特伯雷故事集[Kan3 te4 bo2 lei2 Gu4 shi4 Ji2]
Yesou Puyan or Humble Words of a Rustic Elder, monumental Qing novel by Xia Jingqu 夏敬渠[Xia4 Jing4 qu2]

sentences.english: And when it had touched the bones of Eliseus, the man came to life, and stood upon his feet.
sentences.chinese: 那个死人一接触到厄里叟的骨骸，就复活站起来。

sentences.english: Having refuted the Wise Old Man's wrong ideas, the Foolish Old Man went on digging.
sentences.chinese: 愚公批驳了智叟的错误思想之后，就继续挖山。

sentences.english: He asked me if Iwas reading the story The Old Man and the Sea when he was in.
sentences.chinese: 他问我他进来的时辰我是否正在读白叟与海。

sentences.english: On October 1st, he is arrested for robbing the tomb of King Sobekemsaf.
sentences.chinese: 10月1日，他因为盗窃叟伯克沙夫墓被逮捕。

sentences.english: However, it seems the real power lies in the hands of the Barbary Apes.
sentences.chinese: 然而，直布罗陀的实权似乎操控在叟猴手上。

sentences.english: I asked the daughter who had done them.
sentences.chinese: 我问白叟的女儿是谁画的。

definition: free of worldly concerns/above the fray/at peace with the world
